msContents.summary: Tax register, recording the daily collection of money taxes in the village of Karanis; the name of each tax-payer paying the poll-tax is cross-referenced with a page of another register, where taxpayers were listed geographically

msItemStruct.note: Due to the size of this tax roll (P.Mich. IV/1, 225 + IV/2, 358), its content has been divided in the present database into several cards (one for each column).
Pub. status: Recto; Verso of col. 132 is blank

supportDesc.support: 1 papyrus ; col. 131-132: 36.2 x 28.2 cm; total size: ***

condition.ab: Col. 132: damaged at the bottom (papyrus cut off right of col. 132 when housed in glass)

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Mysthes son of Phaesis and Aynchis grandson of Mysthes (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 189)
Achillas son of Ptollis and Thermouthis grandson of Hieranouphis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 158)
Athenion son of Naaraus and Demarous grandson of Theabenis (Theabennis) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 150)
Onnophris son of Menches and Thaseis grandson Onnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Ptollis son of Akousilaos and Aphrodous grandson of Ptollis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 221)
Onnophris son of Petheus and Ptolema grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 192)
Tauris daughter of Zenon (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 240)
Tiberinus presbyteros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 242)
Maron son of Maron and Herois grandson of Petoraipis (Petsoraipis) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 186)
Heron son of Petesouchos and Tasoucharion grandson of Petesouchos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 171)
Heron son of Horos and Taarpagathes grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 171)
Ptolemaios son of Leonides and Thermouthis grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 217)
Herakles son of Sokrates and Tapetheus grandson of Phaseis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 168)
Phanomgeus son of Pnepheros and Thaesis grandson of Phanomgeus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 245)
Kephalas son of Anchorimphis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 183)
Nausis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 190)
Aunes son of Aunes and Tapetheus grandson of Hermas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 157)
Ptolemaios son of Petheus and Tanesneus grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 218)
Apynchis son of Pnepheros and Tasoucharion grandson of Pakysis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 154)
Sarapion son of Heras thepresbyteros and [Thermouthis] grandson of Herakles (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 225)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: (Col.) 132;;(Pauni 29, continued);Mysthes, son of Phaesis and Aynchis, grandson of Mysthes, for ch(--): 8 drachmai; column 4;Achillas, son of Ptollis and Thermouthis, grandson of Hieranouphis: 4 drachmai; column 7;Athenion, son of Naaraus and Demarous, grandson of Theabenis: 8 drachmai; column 8;Onnophris, son of Menches and Thaseis, grandson Onnophris, for ch(--): 4 drachmai; column 10;Ptollis, son of Akousilaos and Aphrodous, grandson of Ptollis: 8 drachmai; column 11;Onnophris, son of Petheus and Ptolema, grandson of Petheus: 4 drachmai; column 13;Tauris, daughter of Zenon - (through) Tiberinus the elder - for garden land of year 13: for apomoira, 17 drachmai 3 obols; for olive (transportation), 2 drachmai 2 1/2 obols 2 chalkoi; for naubion, 1 drachme 4 1/2 obols; for supplements, 4 drachmai 2 obols 2 chalkoi; for eparourion, 11 drachmai 4 obols; for supplements, 1 drachme; for kollybos, 4 obols. Total: 39 drachmai 2 1/2 obols. (In left margin:) 40 drachmai.;Maron, son of Maron and Herois, grandson of Petoraipis: 16 drachmai; column 20;Heron, son of Petesouchos and Tasoucharion, grandson of Petesouchos: 4 [drachmai]; column 23;Heron, son of Horos and Taarpagathes, grandson of Petheus: 8 drachmai; column 53;Ptolemaios, son of Leonides and Thermouthis, grandson of Petheus, for ch(--): 8 drachmai; column 28;Herakles, son of Sokrates and Tapetheus, grandson of Phaseis, for ch(--): 4 drachmai; column 29;Phanomgeus, son of Pnepheros and Thaesis, grandson of Phanomgeus, for ch(--): 4 drachmai; column 5;Kephalas, son of Anchorimphis - (through) Nausis - for garden land of year 13: for apomoira, 1 drachme 1 1/2 obols; for olive (transportation), 1 obol 2 chalkoi; for naubion, 1/2 obol 2 chalkoi; for supplements, 2 obols; for eparourion, 5 obols; for supplements, 1/2 obol; for kollybos, 1/2 obol. Total: 2 drachmai 5 1/2 obols. (In left margin:) 26 obols.;Aunes, son of Aunes and Tapetheus, grandson of Hermas, for ch(--): 4 drachmai; column 32;Ptolemaios, son of Petheus and Tanesneus, grandson of Petheus, for ch(--): 4 drachmai; column 33;Apynchis, son of Pnepheros and Tasoucharion, grandson of Pakysis, for ch(--): 8 drachmai; column 39;Sarapion, son of Heras the elder and [Thermouthis], grandson of Herakles, for ch(--): 4 drachmai; column 72
